examples: the reservation of positions for non-Americans

definitions.definition: an arrangement whereby something, especially a seat or room, is booked or reserved for a particular person.
an area of land set aside for occupation by North American Indians or Australian Aborigines.
a right or interest retained in an estate being conveyed.
(in the Roman Catholic Church) the practice of retaining a portion of the consecrated elements after mass for communion of the sick or as a focus for devotion.
a qualification to an expression of agreement or approval; a doubt.
examples: some generals voiced reservations about making air strikes

definitions.definition: (in the Roman Catholic Church) the action of a superior of reserving to himself the power of absolution.
a right reserved to the pope of nomination to a vacant benefice.
